cons: Hard work, sometimes not enough support

review_title: Not a nice place to work
pros: There weren’t many positives to say about this place. Probably only the initial induction.
cons:
I witnessed ….and was on the receiving end of daily bullying by certain members of staff which was allowed to continue by management. I also witnessed these same people blaming others for mistakes, whilst getting away with doing less themselves, pretty much get away with doing whatever they like because they’ve been there years and managed to brown nose the boss.
The constant backstabbing ruined my time there and wasn’t good for the residents.

review_title: Conventional but uninspiring approach to mental health.
pros: Mostly friendly staff. Good quality training provided by professional and light mannered trainers. Good standard housing for service users.
cons: Charge for training. Took a month between job offer and job induction. Service-users were pretty much "warehoused". No reimbursed for travel/day-to-day costs.

review_title: Will graft you to the bone -but true carers get that completeley
pros: Good pay, excellent training, wonderful clients
cons: Same people always picking up the extra shifts, don't get warned of shift changes or extra calls/ changes, takes over your life
